meanings.sent1: The reird in the sky puzzled everyone.
meanings.sent2: The reird at the party caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The reird in the movie made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: The reird of colors in the sunset was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The reird in the forest was like something out of a fairy tale.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, high-pitched noise
meanings.sent1: The cat reirded loudly when it saw a mouse.
meanings.sent2: The fire alarm reirded throughout the building.
meanings.sent3: The teapot reirded shrilly on the stove.
meanings.sent4: The whistle reirded sharply in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The siren reirded urgently in the night.

meanings.definition: To act in a strange or eccentric manner
meanings.sent1: She tends to reird when she's nervous.
meanings.sent2: He started to reird during the meeting, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent3: The clown reirded around the circus tent, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The artist reirded with creativity in every brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: The child reirded with joy as he played in the park.
